take me home

hi, i'm alex

I'm a computer science and engineering (course 6-3) student at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, class of 2028.

I've worked at a NASA wind tunnel, tracked a near earth asteriod, fine-tuned a LLM to help researchers write papers, and helped build planes from 6 inches to 12 feet in wingspan.

I'm interested in working in aerospace on autonomy.

I love eating tuna sashimi, photographing birds, writing sci-fi, and obsessing over anything that flies.

coursework

Fundamentals of Programming (6.1010)

Python programming. Graph search, backtracking, recursion, object-oriented programming, functional programming. Wrote a lisp interpreter.

Mobile Autonomous Systems Laboratory (6.9600)

Team-based competition to build a robot to stack cubes. We won 3rd place.

Introduction to Low-level Programming in C and Assembly (6.1904)

C and RISC-V assembly on an ESP-32. Bit manipulation, floating point, pointers, calling convention. Wrote Conway's Game of Life in assembly.

Differential Equations (18.03)
